subject: Re: [junit] assertTrue(true)
msgSnippet: ... I prefer: try { articleProvider.findArticleById( foobar ); fail( Expected NoObjectFoundException); } catch (Exception e) { assertSame(e.getClass(),
messageBody:
haefeleuser wrote:

> Someone in our team writes his tests like this:
>
> try
> {
> articleProvider.findArticleById("foobar");
> }
> catch(NoObjectFoundException e)
> {
> assertTrue(true);
> }
>
> He says the does it because otherwise Checkstyle would complain about
> the empty catch block.
>
> I do it in this manner:
>
> try
> {
> articleProvider.findArticleById("foobar");
> }
> catch(NoObjectFoundException e)
> {
> // Its okay since we expect it.
> }
>
> What do you prefer in the case above: assertTrue(true) or inline
> comment in the catch block?


I prefer:

try {
articleProvider.findArticleById("foobar");
fail("Expected NoObjectFoundException);
} catch (Exception e) {
assertSame(e.getClass(), NoObjectFoundException.class);
// or whatever else seems appropriate (eg. testing getMessage() or
other attribute)
}

--
